page.title: 06Smarden West - Domestic Life
page.content: Labour-saving devices are now common. Refrigerators and washing machines are standard equipment in our homes, and in this area, remote from shops, deep freezers are plentiful, because most families go to town to stock up once a week, and freeze local fruit and vegetables when they are cheap. Dishwashers are comparatively rare. Microwave ovens are becoming popular, especially with working families, for their convenience and speed. Modern technology contributes to home entertainment too: besides the television, now taken for granted, videos provide valuable facilities in an area where a trip to a cinema or theatre involves a long journey. Computers have appeared in several homes but citizens' band radios remain the province of a very few innovators.
